basis: The user expresses consistent, concrete commitments (sunset pause, urge rating, 20â€“30 minute delays, micro-snack rules, weekly check-ins) and explicitly asks for tweaks, indicating strong likelihood of following the plan.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. Overall alignment between goals and actions. Occasional tension around privacy in social settings and logging, but motivation remains high.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible all-or-nothing tendencies if steps are missed; privacy concerns may trigger rationalization to skip certain cues; lingering worry about social judgment or disruption when stepping away.
emotional_triggers: Privacy constraints in social settings, social eating cues, desire for control over urges, fatigue/heat discomfort
coaching_notes: Keep delivering concise, actionable steps. Incorporate non-food coping options (grounding, brief walk) for high-urge nights. Emphasize discreet, privacy-friendly cues and celebrate weekly check-ins. Encourage brief after-action notes to reinforce learning and plan tweaks.
